item.title: Mario: Can Chris Pratt help Nintendo solve the puzzle of video game films?
item.description: Game-to-film adaptations have a chequered history - can Chris Pratt solve the industry puzzle?

item.title: Doctor Who: Russell T Davies returns as programme showrunner
item.description: The It's A Sin writer says he is "beyond excited" to resume the role he filled from 2005 to 2009.

item.title: Roger Michell: Julia Roberts pays tribute to 'kind and gentle' Notting Hill director
item.description: The Notting Hill star says she was "fortunate" to have worked with its director, who has died at 65.

item.title: Jack Whitehall steps down as Brits host
item.description: The comedian and actor has hosted the ceremony for the past four years.

item.title: Cheryl pulls out of show citing Sarah Harding grief
item.description: The singer says she is not emotionally able to perform after her ex-band mate's death.

item.title: Little Boots says Abba's new live band is 'badass cool'
item.description: The pop star is joining Abba's live band next year, after crowd-funding her sparkling new album.

item.title: Strictly's Rose Ayling-Ellis rehearsing without hearing music
item.description: Rose Ayling-Ellis and her dance partner Giovanni Pernice prepare for their first live performance.

item.title: Saoirse Ronan: Macbeth and Lady Macbeth are like Kim and Kanye
item.description: The actress says Kim Kardashian has inspired the "uncharted territory" of her first UK stage role.

item.title: Fifa 22 soundtrack: Why getting on it is a 'bucket list' moment
item.description: This is what it means to young artists to be featured on the playlist for the latest Fifa game.

item.title: Sex Education: Isaac actor George Robinson gets intimate about disability
item.description: George Robinson on subverting expectations as Isaac - the Netflix show's first disabled character.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'In my business, you eat what you kill'
item.description: Music executive Riki Bleau shares his business advice for our CEO Secrets series.

item.title: Twitch hate raids: Minority streamers have 'a target on their back'
item.description: Streamers tell Newsbeat about the targeted hate they get and what they want Twitch to do about it.

item.title: John Challis: Why Serbians have soft spot for late Only Fools actor
item.description: Only Fools and Horses is hugely popular in Serbia, where tributes have been paid to John Challis.

item.title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK season 3's Victoria Scone on making herstory
item.description: Racers, start your engines. We're saying "hello, hello, hello" to the queens of season three.

item.title: Morgan Bullock makes professional debut in Riverdance
item.description: Morgan Bullock from Richmond, Virginia, joins the UK touring company of the acclaimed Irish dance show.

item.title: BTS: Korean boyband open UN general debate with performance and speech
item.description: The UN general debate opened with K-pop band BTS, followed by a speech about sustainable development.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: The Crown and Ted Lasso win big
item.description: Netflix drama The Crown and Apple TV Plus comedy Ted Lasso were the stars of the Emmy Award.

item.title: Street dreams of Nairobi dance crew hoping to beat the odds
item.description: A group of street dancers in Nairobi, Kenya, struggle against the odds to become celebrities.

item.title: Get an Eiffel of this performer walking the line in Paris
item.description: Nathan Paulin walks along a 70m (230ft) high slackline attached to an iconic French landmark.
